body:
Mind filling out the relevant sections in the issue template or removing them for readability? :) 

Does this happen in 0.16 too? If not, I'm moving this to the milestone

rename.from: log diagnostics example crash on mac
rename.to: log diagnostics example crash on mac due to `RenderDiagnosticsPlugin`

body:
> Mind filling out the relevant sections in the issue template or removing them for readability? :)
> 
> Does this happen in 0.16 too? If not, I'm moving this to the milestone

0.16 works fine,    the issue section has been updated

Added to the milestone because this sounds potentially serious, as it may crash other things than just the fps plugin.
Maintainers, feel free to kick this out again :)

I think this is related to wgpu rather than bevy itself? ```rust fn flush_encoder(&mut self) { if let Some(encoder) = self.command_encoder.take() { self.command_buffer_queue .push(QueuedCommandBuffer::Ready(encoder.finish())); // <<<<<<< .finish() } } ```

issue.title: Fix crash with RenderDiagnosticsPlugin on mac

labels.name: D-Trivial
labels.description: Nice and easy! A great choice to get started with Bevy

labels.name: A-Rendering
labels.description: Drawing game state to the screen

labels.name: S-Ready-For-Final-Review
labels.description: This PR has been approved by the community. It's ready for a maintainer to consider merging it

labels.name: A-Diagnostics
labels.description: Logging, crash handling, error reporting and performance analysis

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective

- Fixes #21167 
  (happens with `trace_tracy` feature too, as it adds the plugin automatically)
- There are some uses of `time_span` inside passes, which go around [the check](https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/blob/10325593d5bae88e1089bdf1fa1395f232d5248b/crates/bevy_render/src/diagnostic/internal.rs#L289) for [TIMESTAMP_QUERY_INSIDE_PASSES](https://docs.rs/wgpu-types/latest/wgpu_types/struct.FeaturesWGPU.html#associatedconstant.TIMESTAMP_QUERY_INSIDE_PASSES) feature (unsupported on Apple GPU).
introduced in  #19191

## Solution

- They look like just typos (all in `let pass_span = time_span` form), so replaced with `pass_span`.

There's an occurence of this pattern in `meshlet/visibility_buffer_raster_node.rs`, but it's the variable name that seems  incorrect in this case. I renamed it instead.

## Testing

- Running `log_diagnostics` example no longer crashes on Mac.

body: Moved back to 0.17 since https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/21238 mentions that this also breaks `tracy` on macOS

issue.title: Make `RecordDiagnostics::time_span` take CommandEncoder

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective

- Prevent regression for #21167 / #21238

## Solution

- Make `RecordDiagnostics::time_span` take `CommandEncoder` instead of being generic over command encoder or pass

## Testing

- `cargo check` passes
